item.title: Report E-2025010084
item.description:
Report E-2025010084

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0419 ET, NCH notified ERTS of a cargo release located on their dock. It was reported 1 pound of lithium hydroxide released from 2 50-pound paper bags due to forklift puncture. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor be sent out due to being a hazard class 8. The caller reported the terminal will clean the release with PPE on site and place the spill along with the 2 damaged bags inside of a 55-gallon poly drum. Carechem was notified of the release and report #18879 was provided.

item.title: Report E-2025010053
item.description:
Report E-2025010053

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 02:06 on 12/10, XPO-NWN contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 quarts of "Gardoclean S 5661" from a 54gal poly drum impacting the trailer floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift at BCO. ERTS confirmed the material to be a regulated corrosive and will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of UN3266 Gardoclean released due to forklift puncture. The product impacted the wooden trailer floor 10’x7’ and concrete floor 10’x’8’. The contractor used citric acid to neutralize the release and used oil dri, absorbent pads, and boom to contain/clean-up the release. The contractors containerized impacted absorbent into (1) 55-gallon poly drum, impacted absorbents & PPE into (1) 55-gallon poly drum and overpack into (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
